venture.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a new business activity that involves taking risks
venture.translation[0].definitions[0].no: joint venture (=when two companies do something together)
venture.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to go somewhere that could be dangerous
venture.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
She paused before venturing up the steps to the door.
children who lack the confidence to venture into libraries
venture.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to say or do something in an uncertain way because you are afraid it is wrong or will seem stupid
venture.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: If we had more information, it would be easier to venture a firm opinion.
I ventured to ask him what he was writing.
I ventured that the experiment was not conclusive.
venture.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a new business activity or project that involves taking risks
venture.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: She identified potential customers for a new business venture she was evaluating.
